txt.en: The hoof-print trail you'd been following ended abruptly at a pool of blood.\n\nYou should examine the blood.
The hoof-print trail leads north-west out of Herne.\n\nYou should follow it.
The smell of long-rotted meat assails your nose as a wight rushes towards you
DNT
You've unfortunately found Hulfryn's last sheep.\n\nYou should examine its corpse.
A trail of blood splatters continues north.\n\nYou should follow it.
The last thing the missing sheep did before fleeing was eat from the trough outside Hulfryn's house.\n\nYou should check the area near it for tracks.
The Runaway Sheep
You have defeated the wight that killed Hulfryn's sheep.\n\nYou should return to Herne and tell him.

'What happened? Did you find the sheep?'

As you recount your story, the blood drains from Hulfryn's face.

'Black Riders and dead things walking... omens of worse times ahead. Still, I haven't got the means to leave Herne and find someplace safer. This town is my whole world. I just hope those Riders don't come back....

'[placeholder], was it? Stay safe out there.'
Examine the sheep hoof-prints
Look for tracks near the trough outside of Hulfryn's house
Examine the blood
Wight defeated
One sheep seems to have fled Herne entirely.
A clearly panicked sheep darted out of the pen and towards the north-west
Follow the hoof-print trail
There are faint hoof-prints in the grass
The trail abruptly stops at this pool of blood
DNT
A trail of blood splatters continues north
DNT

'Ever tracked down an animal before? I've heard them Ranger folk are mighty good at it, but I don't know much. You ought to check the pen -- before it fled, the last thing that sheep did was eat at the trough.\n\n'Take care, stranger. There're wolves outside Herne... and I've heard tell of worse things lurking beyond. Just thinking about it is enough to make my skin crawl.'
The blood splatters continue to the north
DNT
The hoof-prints continue north-west
Follow the blood splatters
Examine the dead sheep
You have noticed faint hoof-prints near the trough outside Hulfryn's house.\n\nYou should examine them.
The sheep appears freshly dead
Talk to Hulfryn in Herne
